hide.description:
true if query is disabled (ie should not be returned to the dashboard)
NOTE: this does not always imply that the query should not be executed since
the results from a hidden query may be used as the input to other queries (SSE etc)

intervalMs.description:
Interval is the suggested duration between time points in a time series query.
NOTE: the values for intervalMs is not saved in the query model.  It is typically calculated
from the interval required to fill a pixels in the visualization

maxDataPoints.description:
MaxDataPoints is the maximum number of data points that should be returned from a time series query.
NOTE: the values for maxDataPoints is not saved in the query model.  It is typically calculated
from the number of pixels visible in a visualization

queryType.description:
QueryType is an optional identifier for the type of query.
It can be used to distinguish different types of queries.

refId.description: RefID is the unique identifier of the query, set by the frontend call.

type.description:
Type asserts that the frame matches a known type structure.
Possible enum values:
 - `""` 
 - `"timeseries-wide"` 
 - `"timeseries-long"` 
 - `"timeseries-many"` 
 - `"timeseries-multi"` 
 - `"directory-listing"` 
 - `"table"` 
 - `"numeric-wide"` 
 - `"numeric-multi"` 
 - `"numeric-long"` 
 - `"log-lines"`

typeVersion.description:
TypeVersion is the version of the Type property. Versions greater than 0.0 correspond to the dataplane
contract documentation https://grafana.github.io/dataplane/contract/.

resultAssertions.description: Optionally define expected query result behavior

from.description: From is the start time of the query.

to.description: To is the end time of the query.

timeRange.description:
TimeRange represents the query range
NOTE: unlike generic /ds/query, we can now send explicit time values in each query
NOTE: the values for timeRange are not saved in a dashboard, they are constructed on the fly

hide.description:
true if query is disabled (ie should not be returned to the dashboard)
NOTE: this does not always imply that the query should not be executed since
the results from a hidden query may be used as the input to other queries (SSE etc)

from the number of pixels visible in a visualization

queryType.description:
QueryType is an optional identifier for the type of query.
It can be used to distinguish different types of queries.

refId.description: RefID is the unique identifier of the query, set by the frontend call.

type.description:
Type asserts that the frame matches a known type structure.
Possible enum values:
 - `""` 
 - `"timeseries-wide"` 
 - `"timeseries-long"`

 - `"directory-listing"` 
 - `"table"` 
 - `"numeric-wide"` 
 - `"numeric-multi"` 
 - `"numeric-long"` 
 - `"log-lines"`

typeVersion.description:
TypeVersion is the version of the Type property. Versions greater than 0.0 correspond to the dataplane
contract documentation https://grafana.github.io/dataplane/contract/.

resultAssertions.description: Optionally define expected query result behavior

mode.description:
Non-number reduce behavior
Possible enum values:
 - `"dropNN"` Drop non-numbers
 - `"replaceNN"` Replace non-numbers

replaceWithValue.description: Only valid when mode is replace

from.description: From is the start time of the query.

to.description: To is the end time of the query.

timeRange.description:
TimeRange represents the query range
NOTE: unlike generic /ds/query, we can now send explicit time values in each query
NOTE: the values for timeRange are not saved in a dashboard, they are constructed on the fly

downsampler.description:
The downsample function
Possible enum values:
 - `"sum"` 
 - `"mean"` 
 - `"min"` 
 - `"max"` 
 - `"count"` 
 - `"last"` 
 - `"median"`

hide.description:
true if query is disabled (ie should not be returned to the dashboard)
NOTE: this does not always imply that the query should not be executed since
the results from a hidden query may be used as the input to other queries (SSE etc)

from.description: From is the start time of the query.

upsampler.description:
The upsample function
Possible enum values:
 - `"pad"` Use the last seen value
 - `"backfilling"` backfill
 - `"fillna"` Do not fill values (nill)
